dialogues.text: Did I call you? Tyler studies her with cynical curiosity, looks at a DILD lying atop a dresser.  Marla follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  It's not a threat to you. SIRENS and vehicles SCREECHING outside can be HEARD; door opening and SLAMMING; running FOOTFALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!  Somebody called the cops... She gets to her feet, grabs Tyler, pulls him out the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla LOCKS her door, then pulls Tyler toward the STAIRCA COPS and PARAMEDICS charge up with oxygen and medical kit Marla and Tyler flatten against the wall to let them pass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8-G!  Where's 8-G?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the hall. The rescuers keep running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl who lives there used to be a charming, lovely girl, but she's lost faith in herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Singer, let us help you!  You have every reason to live! Marla yanks Tyler's arm, heading down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a monster!  Infectious human waste!  Good luck trying to save her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler makes coffee.  Marla slouches against the refrigera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I fall asleep, I'm done for. You're gonna have to keep me up all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler chuckles, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was obviously able to handle it. Tyler stands across from Jack, gets a cigarette from a pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, this girl... uh, you're not into her or anything... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Jack's Raging Bile Duct. Tyler lights his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  This chick was up on the table with her legs in the stirrups before the doctor even walked in the room. The things that she said... I've never heard a woman talk like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler smokes, post-coital.  Marla puts her lips to his ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.text: Look at my face. Bob roughly slaps Jack's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fucking great, man!  Fucking great! Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about the guy who invented it? I hear all kinds of things. Supposedly, he was born in a mental institution.  They say he only sleeps one hour a night.  You know about this guy?  Tyler Durden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD SCREAMS insanely as Bob and Jack go at it in th circle of light.  Bob's eyes are wild with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sneaks out of this new location - we've seen non of these guys before - it's a new chapter.  Jack and Bob Stagger out last, Jack being in worse shape.  They both g with religious serenity.  Bob hugs Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Thank you. Bob relaxes the hug and Jack drops to the ground like a sack, completely enervated from the beating he took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight club -- this was mine and Tyler's gift... our gift to the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack has his briefcase on the table, looks at PAPERWORK. Tyler wanders in, carries a dirty pot to the sink.  Jack takes out a cigarette, lights up.  He offers the pack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work.  Going to work. Tyler scratches his chin absently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Do what you like. Tyler walks out the way he came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits staring at his SCREEN SAVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack steps into the open doorway, knocks on the doorframe Boss looks up from his large, expensive desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Where to begin?  With your constant absenteeism?  With your unpresentable appearance?  You're up for review...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Am Jack's Complete Lack of Surprise. Boss sits up in his seat, becoming enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's pretend.  You're the Department of Transportation, and you discover that our company intentionally did nothing about leather seats cured in third world countries with chemicals we know cause birth defects?  Brake linings that fail after a thousand miles.  Fuel injectors that burn people alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just who the fuck do you think you are?!  Get out!  You're fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this?  Keep me on payroll as an outside consultant.  In exchange for my salary, I'll keep my mouth shut.  I won't need to come to the office.  I can do this job from home. Boss stands, moves around his desk, glaring with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little fucker!  I oughta... Jack PUNCHES HIMSELF in the nose.  Blood starts to trickl He punches himself in the jaw, throws himself back as if the force of the punch, SLAMS against a framed picture an SHATTERS the glass.  He falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Am Jack's Smirking Revenge. Jack gets back to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... don't hit me again, please. I'm your responsibility... He PUNCHES himself in the stomach, then in the jaw again. He reels backwards, pulls down a hanging shelf, its conte flying.  He hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some reason, I thought of my first fight -- with Tyler. Jack crawls toward Boss, dripping blood, grabs Boss's leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... give me the paychecks like I asked for.  I won't be any trouble. You won't see me again. Jack climbs up Boss's leg while Boss tries to shake him o Boss stumbles back into his desk, knocking off belongings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under and behind and inside everything this man took for granted, something horrible had been growing. Jack crawls high enough to grab Boss's belt, hoisting himself up.  He dribbles blood an Boss's clothing, SMUDGE blood from his face onto the knuckles of Boss's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And right then, at our most excellent moment together... Two SECURITY GUARDS enter and gape at the sight.  Behind them stand CURIOUS WORKERS, looking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gurgling blood)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't hit me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack holds a CHECK in front of Tyler's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months advance pay.  Six months!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, and... and... Jack digs in his pocket, takes out a thick bundle of CARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-eight airline flight coupons. Plus... hold on... just a minute... Jack holds up a finger, going to open the front door.  He drags an unwieldy SHOPPING CART in behind him; filled wit his COMPUTER, PHONE, FAX and other office equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am now officially self-employed. Jack looks at the cart, then back at Tyler, proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD.  An enormous CROWD of guys, including Jack and Bob, stands around Tyler, who's in the center of the circle, holding up his hands to quiet them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look around... I look around and see a lot of new faces. An enthusiastic RUMBLE from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Which means a lot of you have been breaking the first two rules of fight club. A glum silence falls.  Guys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see in fight club the strongest and smartest men who have ever lived -- an entire generation pumping gas and waiting tables; or they're slaves with white collars. (more) TYLER (cont)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advertisements have them chasing cars and clothes, working jobs they hate so they can buy shit they don't need. We are the middle children of history, with no purpose or place. We have no great war, or great depression.  The great war is a spiritual war.  The great depression is our lives.  We were raised by television to believe that we'd be millionaires and movie gods and rock stars -- but we won't.  And we're learning that fact.  And we're very, very pissed-off. The crowd erupts into a DEAFENING CHORUS of agreement.  J looks at the blazing excitement in the eyes of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the quiet young men who listen until it's time to decide. A fat, MIDDLE-AGED MAN stomps down the stairs, pushing in the crowd, followed by a TALL, HEFTY THUG who holds a GUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I?!  There's a sign on the front that says "Lou's Tavern." I'm fucking Lou.  Who the fuck are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler Durden. Tyler extends his hand for a shake, but Lou SLAPS it away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you motherfuckers you could use my place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a deal worked out with Irvine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irvine?  Irvine's at home with a broken collarbone. Everyone glances guiltily at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't own this place, I do.  How much money's he getting for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's free to all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, stupid fuck, I want everyone outta here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to join our club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I just said?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your friend. Lou SLUGS Tyler in the stomach, doubles him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me now? Tyler gains his breath, determined.  He looks up, turns h head, looking to Jack.  Jack watches, wide-eyed. Tyler straightens, facing Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry, I didn't hear you. Lou PUNCHES Tyler in the face.  Some of the guys move forward, but the Thug points his gun.  Jack-runs forward anyway -- Lou PUNCHES him in the face. More guys move forward, but Tyler waves them off, facing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really need to use this place. Lou proceeds to beat the shit out of Tyler, PUNCHING his face, his stomach.  Tyler collapses to the floor.  Lou starts KICKING his.  Tyler bleeds from the mouth and face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.... that's good.  Get it all out.  You'll feel better. Lou flushes red with exasperation, KICKS more.  Finally, sweating, bewildered, Lou stops.  He looks to the Thug, w is just as bewildered. Suddenly, Tyler SPRINGS UP, grabs onto Lou...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am shit and crazy, to you and this whole fucking world... Tyler's blood spatters on Lou.  Lou tries to shake Tyler off, but Tyler BITES Lou's NECKTIE.  The Thug grabs Tyler and pulls, the necktie tightening and strangling Lou.  Lo slaps at Tyler's face, but recoils from the blood.  Tyler spits and shouts through clenched teeth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know where I've been. Tyler bear hugs Lou, pulls him to the floor.  Tyler rubs bloody face into Lou's face.  The Thug lifts Tyler.  Tyle clings to Lou's belt, dragging Lou as he is dragged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need this place.  We need it. Please let us keep it, please... Blood dribbles out of Tyler's mouth, spattering Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleeeeeease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Okay, fuck it!  Use the basement!  Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need some towels, Lou.  We need replacement light bulbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Christ!  Fucking let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Thank you, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me!! Tyler lets go of Lou's belt.  Lou scrambles away.  The Th drops Tyler, trying to keep clear of the blood.  Lou gets his feet, looks at Tyler, then at the rest of the guys. and the Thug back away... slamming the door behind. Fight club surrounds Tyler.  They help him up, move him t a crate.  Tyler sits slumped for a long moment, his breathing labored... then, he sits back, crossing his leg and looking to the group, his demeanor businesslike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This week, each of you has a homework assignment.  You're going to go out and start a fight with a total stranger... (pause, drooling blood)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to start a fight... and you're going to lose. Jack beams in appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky trips a passing YUPPIE.  The Yuppie falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as easy as it sounds.  People'll do just about anything to avoid a fight. The Yuppies gets up, angry, and Ricky PUNCHES him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Wha... What the hell... what are you doing?!  Who are you?!! The Yuppie backs away.  Ricky follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!  Keep away!

dialogues.speaker: NO...
dialogues.text: Ricky TACKLES the Yuppie.  The Yuppie struggles spastical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you!?  Why are you attacking me... ?! Having no recourse, the Yuppie begins trading blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MECHANIC WITH A BATTERED FACE uses a hose to wash the sidewalk.  As MEN pass, he jerks the hose up and SPRAYS t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, jackass! These men continue on their way. The Mechanic sprays a third man, a SEMINARY STUDENT, who looks down, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you did that on purpose! The Mechanic DOUSES the Seminarian.  The Seminarian grabs the hose, wrestling the Mechanic for it.  The Mechanic shoves the Seminarian, who responds with a half-assed PUN The Mechanic purposely takes it.  The Seminarian starts t run away.  The Mechanic sprints after him, PUNCHING the Seminarian in the back of the neck.  They fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIST smashes a JAW.  Guys CHEER.  An arm snakes around neck and squeezes, blood and sweat dripping.  It's the YUPPIE and the SEMINARIAN fighting.  Tyler walks around t perimeter of the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now nobody was the center of fight club except the two men fighting. The leader walked around in the crowd, out in the darkness. Tyler hands ENVELOPES out to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone took a homework assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and another FIGHT CLUBBER paste up a BILLBOARD whic reads: "DID YOU KNOW? YOU CAN USE YOUR OLD MOTOR OIL TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANDS use a MARKER, writing on a FILE: "Disinformation."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Tyler, in work gloves, armed with TOOLS, work together to lift the entire METAL PLATE of EXIT SPIKES fr the ground.  They reverse it, then replace it.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Jack and Tyler walk away, each carrying a 4x4 plank of WO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's fight club in Delaware City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.  Local 15, Monday nights. As they pass PARKED CARS, they SWING the planks against front bumpers -- activating ALARMS and INFLATING AIR BAGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Local 8 just started in Penns Grove. And, Bob said he was at fight club in Newcastle last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newcastle?  Did you start that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you did. In the background, a CAR quickly EXITS the parking lot -- front tires EXPLODING, wheel rims throwing sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER, MOTHER, YOUNG DAUGHTER and SON, eat dinner, watch TELEVISION.  Suddenly, the TV IMAGE turns to SNOW and sta Family members stop eating.  Father picks up the REMOTE, points it -- all channels are SNOW. Father turns the TV OFF.  He and his family members look each other, utensils in hand, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yuppie SWINGS a BASEBALL BAT -- DESTROYS a digital SATELLITE DISH.  The Yuppie and the Seminarian move on, climbing to a neighboring rooftop.  They come upon anothe DISH.  The Seminarian takes the bat, takes a SWING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANDS place NEWS CLIPPINGS into a FILE: "Mischief."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two AIRPLANE MAINTENANCE,MEN, with bruised faces, rip ope a box from a PRINT SHOP.  They dig up AIRPLANE SAFETY INSTRUCTION CARDS and begin inserting them into each seatback.  We SEE a CARD - it shows passengers SCREAMING and FLAILING ABOUT IN TERROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge office.  Rows and rows of desks.  FIGHT CLUB MEMBERS work: one guy moving from COMPUTER MONITOR to COMPUTER MONITOR, using a DRILL to drill a hole into the top of ea Other guys follow behind, with FUNNELS and CANS of GASOLI filling each monitor with gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Files and newspaper clippings are piled up.  HANDS write a new FILE FOLDER: "Arson."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yuppie crumbles a loaf of stale bread into a bucket, stirring it with a big spoon, mixing in a BOTTLE of EX-LA Nearby, Rob throws handfuls of wet BREADCRUMBS to PIGEONS HUNDREDS of PIGEONS -- a rooftop feeding-frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and Jack cross the parking lot, towards the convenience store.  Jack wears a BACKPACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have that a minute... Tyler takes the BACKPACK, unzips it, searching the conten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homework assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Tyler takes out a HANDGUN, hands the backpack back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human Sacrifice. Jack turns white, staring at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BACK DOOR opens and Tyler brings the store's CLERK ou at gunpoint, forces him to his knees.  Jack follows, freaked.  Tyler points the gun at the Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a long enough time line, the survival rate for everyone drops to zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your wallet. The Clerk fumbles his wallet out of his pocket and Tyler snatches it.  Tyler pulls out the DRIVER'S LICENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond K. Hessel. 1320 SE Benning, apartment A.  A small, cramped basement apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give basement apartments letters instead of numbers.  Raymond, you're going to die. Tyler rummages through the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a picture of Mom and Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesssss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom and dad will have to call kindly doctor so-and-so to dig up your dental records, because there won't be much left of your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, God, no... Raymond begins to weep, shoulders heaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expired community college student ID card.  What did you used to study, Raymond K. Hessel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-S-Stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Stuff."  Were the mid-terms hard? Tyler rams the gun barrel against Raymond's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you what you studied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biology, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you want to be, Raymond K. Hessel? Raymond weeps and says nothing.  Tyler COCKS the gun. Raymond GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question, Raymond, was "what did you want to be?" A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A veterinarian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... animals and s-s-s ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff.  That means you have to get more schooling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much school. Tyler shoves Raymond's wallet back into Raymond's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather be dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, no, God, no! Tyler moves the gun right between Raymond's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO
dialogues.text: Tyler UNCOCKS the gun, lowers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm keeping your license.  I know where you live.  I'm going to check on you.  If you aren't back in school and on your way to being a veterinarian in six weeks, you will be dead.  Get the hell out of here. Raymond staggers to his feet, heads down an alleyway.  Ja and Tyler watch Raymond flee, then Tyler looks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine how he feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler brings the gun to his own head, pulls the trigger - CLICK.  Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care, that was horrible. Tyler walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow will be the most beautiful day of Raymond K. Hessell's life. Jack watches Tyler go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His breakfast will taste better than any meal he has ever eaten. Jack turns to look the direction Raymond ran.  He finally turns back, following after Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: in the deserted office, gasoline filled COMPUTER MONITORS begin to EXPLODE...BOOM...BOOM...BOOM..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luxury AUTOMOBILES are parked, splattered with BIRD SHIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIEWED OUT 3RD STORY WINDOW: Tyler uses a RAKE, dragging across rocks and dirt.  He stops a moment, rake on his shoulder, staring off.  Then, back to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You are not how much money you have in the bank.  You are not the shoes you wear. Tyler's marking a large SQUARE in the weeds and rubble of the backyard, kicking rocks away, dragging the rake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not the contents of your wallet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER has a broken nose.  The bus is empty, except f Jack, in the very last seat, sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a plan.  Maybe you just didn't see it till it hit you between the eyes. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, it started to make sense... in a Tyler sort of way.  No fear.  No distractions.  The ability to let that which does not matter truly slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gets off the bus.  As the bus pulls away, we see it dropped Jack off right in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters.  Tyler, dressed in FATIGUES and splattered w PAINT, grabs BEERS from the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Jack notices ROPE and RAPPELLING TOOLS on the table.  Tyl comes to hand Jack a bunch of beers, nod to the living ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on in.  We're celebrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, bewildered, enters carrying beers.  Tyler does NOT follow.  BOB, RICKY and several other fight club guys sit front at the TV, chanting not too loudly, all also dresse in FATIGUES and splattered with PAINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not how much money you have in the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh, wait... they're back to it... Bob goes to turn up the TV.  One guy, sixteen years old w an angelic face, ANGEL FACE, gets up to take beer from Ja

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, thanks. Angel face starts distributing beer amongst his cohorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh!  Watch! Jack looks to the TV -- it shows a LIVE shot of the "PARK MORRIS BUILDING."  The building has a GIANT, GRINNING FAC PAINTED on it -- two BROKEN WINDOWS for EYES, with flames pouring out... FIRETRUCKS spray water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police Commissioner Jacobs has just arrived... just a second... excuse me, Commissioner, could you tell us what you think has happened? COMMISSIONER JACOBS, a wrinkled official, turns to camera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We believe this is related to the recent acts of vandalism around the city.  It's some kind of organized group, and we are coordinating a rigorous investigation. Jack turns, sees Tyler in the archway, watching him.  Tyl tips his beer to toast, pulls back, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you guys do? They all BURST INTO LAUGHTER.  They look at Jack and shak their heads.  Jack doesn't get it.  Suddenly, the guys' faces turn to stone.  Bob sits rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rule of Project Mayhem is... you do not ask questions. Jack stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luxurious BANQUET.  Commissioner Jacobs guzzles champag He rises and starts out of the room.  Jack, in a WAITER'S UNIFORM, looks apprehensively to OTHER WAITERS: BOB... RICKY... ANGEL FACE -- who all give each other a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs saunters down an empty hall.  He stops to check hi tie in a mirror.  He pushes open the door of the MEN'S BATHROOM -- face to face with TYLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler GRABS Commissioner Jacobs, pulling him into the bathroom.  He slaps a piece of tape over Jacobs' mouth. OTHER "WAITERS" rush in.  Jack stays back to keep the doo shut.  Tyler and the others hold Jacobs, pulling down his pants.  Bob snaps a rubber band -- reaches to Jacob s cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrap it around the top of his hackie- sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, his balls are ice cold. Ricky produces a KNIFE, moves it down to Jacob's testicle Jacobs is bug-eyed.  Jack, red-faced, keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to continue your "rigorous investigation."  You will publicly state that there is no underground group.  Or -- imagine, the rest of your life with your scrotum flapping empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth taped)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no... please, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll send one to the New York Times and one to the Los Angeles Times. Press release style.  Your nuts will be bicoastal.  Understood?  The people you're after are everyone you depend on. (more) TYLER (cont)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do your laundry, cook your food and serve you dinner.  We guard you while you sleep.  We drive your ambulances.  Do not fuck with us. Ricky makes a dramatic cut with the knife, causing Jacobs JUMP -- Ricky holds up the severed RUBBER BAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Tyler and the others file quickly out the back SERV ENTRANCE.  Tyler gives Angel Face a hearty slap on the ba Angel Face smiles at Tyler, nods, grinning. Jack sees this, his eyes narrowing, stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight club in full swing.  Jack battles Angel Face, BEATI the shit out of him with unprecedented viciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like putting a bullet between the eyes of every Panda that wouldn't screw to save its species. The crowd shouts maniacally, save Tyler, who watches with inscrutable stone face. Angel Face tries to speak, but Jack POUNDS too hard.  Blo flies.  The crowd begins to grow QUIETER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to open the dump valves on oil tankers and smother all the French beaches I'd never see. Finally, Angel Face lies still, unconscious.  Jack stops, stares down, numb.  Jack walks away -- the crowd parts to let him pass.  Jack scans faces... finds Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go, Psycho-Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like destroying something beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAINING.  Tyler and Jack walk through pools of streetligh A idling car HONKS.  Tyler leads Jack toward it.  A bruis faced VALET PARKER thrown keys to Tyler, but Jack interce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, Mr. Durden.  Airport parking, long term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions to car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you, Mr. Durden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler gets in the driver's seat.  Jack gets into the fron passenger seat.  Ricky and the mechanic are in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler pulls the stolen car away from the curb.  It has tw bumperstickers: "RECYCLE YOUR ANIMALS" and "MAKE MINE VEA

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: RAIN GUSHES down.  Jack stews, silent.  The car moves dow a HIGHWAY, intermittently illuminated by oncoming headlig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tyler shrugs; turns on the RADIO, ignores Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't I told about "Project Mayhem?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I have told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't I involved from the beginning?  You and I started fight club together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight club was the beginning.  Now it's out of the basements and there's a name for it -- Project Mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rule of Project Mayhem is you do not ask questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is as much mine as yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a needlepoint club?  Is it about you and me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?  A statement of purpose... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I E-mail you?  Should I put this on your "action item list?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know about Project Mayhem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rule of Project Mayhem --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricky and Mechanic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!! (to Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what's going on. Tyler steers the car into the opposite lane, accelerates. Opposing HEADLIGHTS get closer fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This does not belong to us.  We are not the leaders.  We are not special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the all-singing, all-dancing crap of the world.  We are all part of the same compost heap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler... Tyler steers back into the proper lane.  The other CAR fl past, HORN SOUNDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell ... ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You choose your level of involvement. I won't make decisions for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking questions that don't have answers.  You know just as much about Project Mayhem as anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's true. Tyler again steers into the oncoming lane, speeding up. Through the windshield: oncoming headlights -- a TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler... what is this... ! Jack fights        to turn the wheel, but Tyler uses both

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you wish you'd done before you died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint a self-portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Build a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you died right now, how would you feel about your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would feel nothing about my life? Is that what you want to hear?! The oncoming truck HONKS and FLASHES its LIGHTS.  It move to the other side of the road.  Tyler steers there, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to hear the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck my life.  Fuck fight club.  Fuck you and fuck Marla.  I'm sick of this.  How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I blew up your condo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitting bottom isn't a weekend retreat!  It's not a seminar!  You have to forget everything you know, everything you think you know -- about life, about friendship, about you and me. Nearing impact with the oncoming truck, Tyler takes his hands off the wheel -- Jack keeps his grip, turns the wheel... the car swerves... The truck ROARS past, spraying water, HORN BLASTING. Tyler looks at Jack, his hands in the air.  Jack looks at Tyler with dead eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... fine... Jack takes his hands off the wheel, holds them in the air Tyler studies Jack face, impressed.  Tyler makes no move take the wheel. THROUGH THR WINDSHIELD: a STALLED CAR ahead on the side o the road, surrounded by flares. Jack and Tyler's eyes stay locked as the car drifts onto shoulder... heading for the stalled car.  Their faces are illuminated by the light of the flares.  Tyler smiles. They SMASH into the stalled car -- AIRBAGS INFLATE!  The back of their car whips around and carries it into a ass- over-tea-kettle ROLL down a hill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never been in a car accident. This must've been what all those statistics felt like before I filed them into my reports. The car finally hits the bottom, lying on its roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler crawls from the passenger side.  He walks around... opens the driver's side door and drags Jack out into the mud.  Ricky and the Mechanic climb out the broken rear window.  Tyler sits beside the stunned, wounded Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just had a near-life experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack lies in bed, traumatized, eyes empty, staring at the ceiling.  Tyler sits in a nearby chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the world I see -- you're stalking elk through the damp canyon forests around the ruins of Rockefeller Center.  You will wear leather clothes that last you the rest of your life.  You will climb the wrist- thick kudzu vines that wrap the Sears Tower.  You will see tiny figures pounding corn and laying-strips of venison on the empty car pool lane of the ruins of a superhighway. Tyler stands, gives Jack's head a pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better, champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits at the table, sips coffee.  He's pale, dazed, seems broken.  He hears the faint SOUND of SAWING and HAMMERING, unsure of where it's coming from. Marla walks into the kitchen and goes straight to the counter.  Her back is to Jack as he looks at her.  She po ccffee and lights a cigarette.  A beat of silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be out of your way in a sec. She seems to be as weak as Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... don't have to... leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really... I mean it. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been going to your groups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the smart move on her part. Marla turns to face Jack, a grim expression on her face. There's a BRUISE on her ARM.  Jack gets up, moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we both... caught up like this... with... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came so close to saying Tyler's name, I could feel it vibrate inside my mouth. Marla looks a him, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  Why does a weak person have to go out and find a strong person... to hang onto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you get out of it? Faint SOUND of SAWING and HAMMERING.  Jack can't quite figure where it's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That... sawing and hammering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we been talking too long?  Must we change the subject? Jack turns -- through the crack of the open basement door Tyler's staring at Jack from the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harsh whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not talking about me, are you? Jack reacts, turns back to Marla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marla and Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That day you came over to my place to play doctor... what was going on there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marla and Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is over. Marla comes to touch Jack's hair.  Jack closes the baseme door.  Marla sees the kiss-scar on Jack's hand, grabs his hand.  Jack tries to pull it back, but Marla keeps a grip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  Who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy or girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you ask if it's a guy or a girl?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you get bent if I asked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me... (pulls his hand free)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're afraid to say. Marla backs away, closes her eyes, struggling with frustration.  She leaves out the back door, not looking b Jack leans against the wall.  After a moment, he opens th basement door, heads downstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler walks upstairs, passing as Jack continues down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks around.  TRIPLE-DECKER BUNKS clutter the basement, as many as can fit into the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling upstairs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler... ?  What's this for? From upstairs, the SOUND of the DOORBELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack opens the door.  Ricky stands on the porch, staring ahead in subordinate military style.  He's in black pants black shirt, black shoes, holds a PAPER BAG, with an army surplus MATTRESS rolled-up at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... what can I do for you, Ricky? Tyler steps up beside Jack, looks Ricky over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too young.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... Tyler comes back inside, shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Too young?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the applicant is young, we tell him he's too young.  Old, too old. Fat, too fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Applicant?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the applicant waits at the door for three days without food, shelter or encouragement, then he can enter and begin training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Training?"  Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack comes out, walks around Ricky, hands in his pockets, unsure.  Tyler watches, nods for Jack to go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, look.  You're too... young to... train here.  You should probably be on you way. No response from Ricky, who remains at attention.  Jack g back inside.  Tyler closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky remains at attention.  Jack bursts out with a BROOM knocks the brown bag out of Ricky's hand, kicks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you deaf?!  I told you to leave! You will never get inside this house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky's still there.  Tyler comes out, friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, friend, I'm sorry for the misunderstanding.  It's not the end of the world.  Just go away.  You're trespassing and I will call the police.  Nothing personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, same spot.  Jack bursts outside with the broom aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never getting through this door, you stupid little weasel!  Look at me when I talk to you... ! He WHACKS Ricky in the shoulder with the broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your major malfunction!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the window, Tyler sips coffee, watches this scene on t PORCH below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later, we all became what Tyler wanted us to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky's there.  Bob is now next to him, in black, with a paper bag in hand, mattress at his feet.  Tyler steps out Jack stays in the doorway, locking eyes on Bob.  To all t following questions, Ricky answers "Sir!" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have two black shirts?  Two pair black trousers?  One pair black boots?  Two pair black socks?  One black coat?  Three hundred dollars personal burial money?  Go inside. Ricky goes in.  Tyler turns to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too old.  Sorry.  And, you're too fat.  Nice seeing you. Bob looks genuinely hurt.  He picks up his mattress and starts away.  Tyler looks at Jack and rolls his eyes.  Ja follows Bob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob... Bob, wait... (leading Bob back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain this to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRICKETS CHIRP.  Bob stands at at rigid attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and Jack stand in bathroom doorway, watching Ricky finish SHAVING off all of his HAIR.  Tyler comes to give top of Ricky's head a sharp SLAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monkey, ready to be shot into space.  A Space Monkey, ready to sacrifice himself for Project Mayhem. From here on, all those with shaved heads: "SPACE MONKEYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks out the window.  Bob stands motionless.  There another "applicant," a SHORT GUY, beside Bob.  Ricky come out the front door with the BROOM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too fucking old, fatty!  We don't want your kind here! (to short guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too short.  Go away, stumpy! Go back to the circus! Ricky HITS them with the broom, then goes in, SLAMS THE D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it went...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler works with a HALF DOZEN SPACE MONKEYS, preparing th square of backyard.  They pull weeds, clear rocks; workin with shovels, rakes, etc.  They cart away WHEELBARROWS of rocks and carry in SACKS of FERTILIZER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler built his army. IN THE KITCHEN WINDOW, Jack watches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack keeps watching out the window, eats toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what purpose, might one ask? Well, one might ask, if not for the first rule of Project Mayhem. Jack turns to look around the kitchen.  THREE SPACE MONKE work -- one SCRUBBING the FLOOR, one WASHING DISHES, one SCRUBBING the walls.  Jack walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Tyler We Trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack opens his eyes, awakening to sunlight thru the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack slowly pushes open the door to Tyler's room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler... The room is empty.  Jack stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack comes downstairs... finds DOZENS of SPACE MONKEYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters.  Space Monkeys render fat and make soap.  Th pinch HERBS, adding them to the mix.  They add VODKA.  Of to the side, a couple Monkeys stir a vat of RICE.  On the wall is a big bulletin board with HUNDREDS of DRIVER's LICENSES; a sign above it: "HUMAN SACRIFICES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You are not a beautiful and unique snowflake.  You are the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We are all part of the same compost heap."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planet Tyler. Jack dips a spoon into the rice, chomps on it irritatingl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We are the all-singing, all-dancing crap of the world." Jack picks up a BOTTLE of VODKA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to hug the walls, trapped inside this clockwork of Space Monkeys, cooking and working and sleeping in teams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters, vodka in hand.  TEN SPACE MONKEYS here, read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house became a living thing, wet inside from so many people sweating and breathing.  So many people moving, the house moved. Jack walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters.  Angel Face reads a book, marks on a chart. Space Monkeys shuffle PAPERS and NEWS CLIPPINGS.  Walls a lined with FILES, each labeled with a STREET ADDRESS, und SIGNS: "Mischief," "Disinformation," "Arson." Jack's eye lingers on "Arson." He starts flipping through a file.  Angel Face comes to take the file from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wouldn't interest you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rule of Project --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right. As Angel Face replaces the file, Jack notices -- a LYE- BURNED KISS-SCAR on the back of Angel Face's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes a swig of vodka, smokes.  In the BACKGROUND, a Space Monkey WHACKS an APPLICANT with a BROOM.  It's a ritual; no words.  Other Space Monkeys tend the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all alone.  I Am Jack's Broken Heart. Jack drops his cigarette in the gravel, steps on it.  A Space Monkey immediately comes to clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are all these people? Jack turns, sees Marla with an overnight bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paper Street Soap Company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here!  Tyler's not here anymore!  He's gone away! Marla stares at Jack, miserable.  A tear runs down her cheek.  She turns and walks away.  Jack watches her go. There's a LOUD COMMOTION from the house, VOICES SHOUTING. Jack heads to the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters.  Ricky crawls, bleeding from a gunshot wound the LEG.  Space Monkeys begin a rudimentary job of treati the wound.  Other Space Monkeys carry in a DEAD BODY in BLACK CLOTHES and SKI MASK, putting it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Space Monkeys stare at the body.  The Mechanic, sweating, gets to his knees and pulls the ski mask off the corpse - it's BOB, with a gunshot wound to the HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob... oh, Christ... Jack pushes past a Space Monkey, stares down, stricken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what happened... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on assignment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCULPTURE adorned with a giant GLOBE on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to kill two birds with one stone: A SERIES of EXPLOSIONS blasts the GLOBE free.  It ROLLS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece of corporate art... The GLOBE ROLLS downhill, to the street -- rolling over o parked LUXURY CAR after another, crunching car roofs and causing windows to explode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and trash a trendy coffee bar. Then, the GLOBE arrives at the lobby of a HOTEL... BROADSIDES a limo, RICOCHETS... ROLLS directly into the front of a closed ARROSTO coffee bar, SMASHING windows... DECIMATING coffee push-pats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, the Mechanic and Ricky FLEE, LAUGHING at their handiwork.  They split up, running O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had it all worked out, man.  It went smooth... until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police!  Freeze! O.S. SOUNDS of GUNSHOTS and FLASHES of MUZZLE FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mechanic looks up from Bob's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shot Bob... they shot him in the head.  Those fuckers... Jack walks away from Bob's corpse, distraught, holds his head, turns to look back, his eyes filling with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to get rid of the evidence. We have to get rid of this body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bury him... Jack looks around in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden.  Take him there.  Move, people.  Let's do this! Several Space Monkeys gather around Bob's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... ! Space Monkeys stop.  Jack gets between them and Bob, SHOV a few Space Monkeys back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off him!  Get off...! What the hell do you think you're doing... ? Evidence?!  This is a man... !  You killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was killed in action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Look at you!  You're... you're running around in ski masks, exploding things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was killed serving Project Mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what he would have wanted, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he wanted?  Look... look at him. Look at him!  What does he want? (wipes tears, points at Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a person.  This is not a cog in your machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, this is Project Mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  This is a man -- this man has a name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, in Project Mayhem, we have no names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Wrong!  This man's name is Robert Paulson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Paulson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Paulson is dead.  He's dead, because of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Everyone just stares at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In death, a member of Project Mayhem has a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Robert Paulson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Robert Paulson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Robert Paulson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Robert Paulson!  His name is Robert Paulson... Jack backs away, surrounded, PUSHES his way out of the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack barges in, goes to the desk, rifling through drawers He finds FLIGHT COUPONS, used and unused.  The used coupo have the flight information, including the destination cities.  The PHONE RINGS.  Jack answers it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Detective Stern of the arson unit.  I'd like to see you in my office tomorrow morning... Jack, in a panic, HANGS UP. INSERT - AN AIRPLANE TAKES OFF...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits stiffly in a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to the cities on Tyler's used tickets stubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hurries from the terminal, runs to a TAXI ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In every city, I branched out from the airport to downtown, bar- hopping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's looks out the window, intently watching buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know how or why, but I could look at fifty different bars, and somehow I just knew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to driver, points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Let me out, right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters.  He sees several MALE PATRONS with FIGHT BRUISES.  Jack moves to the bar.  The BARTENDER has a bro arm and swollen face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Tyler Durden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an emergency.  It's important I find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could help you... sir. The bartender WINKS at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every city I went to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as soon as I set foot off the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I knew fight club was close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack RUNS through the airport, lugging his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler was setting up franchises, all over the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PROPRIETOR, his head bandaged, is confronted by Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know where Tyler is.  Can't you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you're disturbing the other patrons with your laudish behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one else here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I haven't the faintest idea what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my face.  I'm a member.  I just need to know if you've seen Tyler Durden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not disclosed to bespeak any such information to you, nor would I, even if I had said information you want, at this juncture be able. Jack looks around, incredibly frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I have to insist you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gives up, shoves his way out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits on the bus, looking out the window.  The bus st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under and behind and inside everything I took for granted, something horrible had been growing. OUT THE WINDOW, a CONSTRUCTION WORKER with a BROKEN NOSE works a jackhammer.  He stops, wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TVs show football.  Jack is seated with TWO BRUISED PATRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever seen him.  No one knows what he looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has facial reconstructive surgery every three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true about fight club in Miami?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mr. Durden building an army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I asleep... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits awake.  Everyone around him is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I slept?  I'm not sure if Tyler is my bad dream or if I'm Tyler's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack steps off the sidewalk, hailing a TAXI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alleyway's deserted.  Jack heaft to rusty CELLAR DOOR He opens the doors, looks around, heads down stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was living in a state of perpetual deja vu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters this dark basement, walks ahead in the dim light.  The place is damp and empty.  Jack stops, looks d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere I went, I felt I had already been there. At his feet -- DRIED BLOOD on the concrete floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks in.  The place is empty.  He walks to a KITCHE DOOR, opens it and peers in at... a GROUP of KITCHEN WORK solemnly stand in a circle, chanting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Robert Paulson.  His name is Robert Paulson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from behind Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, sir. Jack whirls, startled -- facing the wounded BARTENDER, wh wears a NECK BRACE, his nose a smashed eggplant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a test, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... it's a test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in here last Thursday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were standing right where you are now, asking how good our security is. It's tight as a drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this part of the test? Jack nods slowly.  The Bartender holds up his hand, shows the KISS SCAR on the back of his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who did this to me. You're Mr. Durden, sir.  Tyler Durden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please return your seatbacks to their full upright and locked position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack bursts inside, out of breath, runs to grab the phone punches a number, doesn't bother to turn on the lamp. INTERCUT WITH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla, it's me.  Have we... have we ever had sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of stupid question is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the answer's "yes" or because the answer's "no?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just answer me, for Christsake?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, you want to know if I think we were just having sex or making love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did make love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you're calling it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck me, then snub me.  You love me, you hate me.  You show me your sensitive side, then you turn into a total asshole!  Is that a pretty accurate description of our relationship, Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've just lost cabin pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say my name!  What's my name!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler Durden!  Tyler Durden, you fucking freak.  What's going on?  I'm coming over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla, no, wait... As Marla HANGS UP.  Jack stares at the receiver, dazed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got six fight clubs in Chicago now... Jack spins, dropping the phone -- TYLER sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four in Milwaukee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about, Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, we're definitely filling a void in the rural South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do people think I'm you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke your promise.  You talked to her about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do people think I'm Tyler Durden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me, Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do people think anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  Tell me! Tyler shakes his head in disgust, extremely irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People think that you're me, because you and I happen to share the same body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this really news to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I control it, and you imagine yourself watching me...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Commissioner Jacobs checks his tie in a mirror, goes to o the door of the MEN'S BATHROOM -- face to face with JACK.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: JACK stands surrounded by eager fight club MEMBERS, under the bare bulb, talking and behaving like Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rule of fight club is -- you don't talk about fight club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, sometimes you control it...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Jack stands in the yard, VODKA in hand, yells at Marla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here!  Tyler's not here anymore!  He's gone away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see me and hear me, but no one else can...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: JACK sits alone on the curb, watching the nearby freeway. He talks to someone beside him, but nobody's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone? (thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boss, probably. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would you fight? Jack listens, looks at the empty space beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't really know my Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, when you fall asleep, I do things without you...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: JACK is on top of Marla, sweating, making violent love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go places without you.  Get things done...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The Parker Morris Building. JACK, Bob, Ricky, Angel Face and another GUY rappel down side, SPRAYING PAINT.  JACK is "TYLER" in demeanor, mannerisms, speech...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not your job.  You are not how much money you have in the bank. TWO WINDOWS SHATTER OUTWARD -- TWO MEN look out and yell:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not my job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not how much money I have in the bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's having trouble catching his breath.  Tyler stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  Happy?  I asked for one thing from you... one simple promise.  Now look what you've done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to do something about Marla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  We okay... a little codependent, sure, but... Jack shakes his head in disbelief, in denial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  This isn't true.  We... we were around other people, together, both of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never talked to me in front of anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, wrong -- what about the car crash... the two guys in the backseat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?  They're lunatics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took me to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is rented in your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night jobs -- while you were sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Marla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Marla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's... you... you're fucking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, well... technically, no. Jack stands, trying to absorb, feeling ill, trying to fin words, then -- he suddenly FAINTS to the floor, OUT COLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a "changeover."  The movie goes on, and nobody in the audience has any idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's eyes snap open.  He sits up, alone.  He remembers previous night... looks at himself in the mirror... looks the clock -- 4:35am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room door SLAMS OPEN as Jack bursts out of the room, carrying his suitcase, SPRINTING for the STAIRWELL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack races down, three steps at a time, dragging his suitcase - BOOM, BOOM, BOOM - behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hurries to the front door, his suitcase half-broken open, passing the front desk.  A DESK CLERK calls after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... sir?  Are you checking out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The clerk follows the length of the counter, waves a PAPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please initial this list of phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill me! Jack goes out the door, freezes.  He rushes back in, goin to the desk -- snatches the bill, studies it: many NUMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...when were these made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says right there, sir... between two and three-thirty this morning. Jack looks at the clerk, at the bill, at the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a copy of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares out the window, his face set hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had I been going to bed earlier every night?  Have I been sleeping later? Has Tyler been in charge longer and longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAXI halts.  Jack leaps out, points to the GRUNGY CABBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks in to find the place EMPTY and DESERTED.  He continues on into the KITCHEN, gawks at BATHTUBS and CANISTERS holding vast amounts of liquid.  There are HOSE GAS MASKS, BEAKERS, TEST TUBES and PUMPS. He picks up a BOTTLE labeled "NITRIC ACID."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits by the PHONE, pulls out the HOTEL BILL, runs hi finger up and down the list of PHONE NUMBERS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deja vu, all over again... Jack finger stops on a NUMBER.  He dials, phone to his ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen-eighty-eight. Jack sees a file on the wall: "1888 CENTURY PARK EAST."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintenance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, something is going to happen, something terrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about us, sir.  We're solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait, there's been a mix-up. Everything's changed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you'd say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abort the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you'd say that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I'd call you a fascist dickhead?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, you said you might. Jack HANGS UP, desperately dials the next number on the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (front phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-one-sixty.  Maintenance. Jack sees a file: "2160 PICO BOULEVARD."  He throws the phone, pocketing the bill.  He grabs up all the FILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's TAXI halts.  Marla walks out of the lobby doors, s Jack getting out of the cab, laden with files...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla! Marla makes a sharp turn, walking away.  Jack follows, hugging the files to his chest, catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your whacked-out, bald freaks hit me with a fucking broom.  I thought they were going to break my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The were burning their fingertips with lye.  The stink was unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla... I need to talk to you.  It's going to take a tremendous act of faith on your part for you to hear me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes an avalanche of bullshit. Marla heads into a DINER.  Jack follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A little more faith than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla sits in a BOOTH.  Jack sits across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear anything you've got to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a minute, Marla, alright... just sixty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty seconds, then I'm out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, you have every right.  I need you to do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done you enough favors. A WAITER with a BLACK EYE appears at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!  Anything you order is free of charge, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it free of charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... I'm Tyler Durden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, I'll have the clam chowder... fried chicken and a baked potato with everything and a chocolate chiffon pie. Jack look to the pass-through WINDOW into the kitchen whe THREE COOKS look out with STITCHES in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean food, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, sir, may I advise against the lady eating the clam chowder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, no clam chowder.  That's it. The waiter snaps to attention and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got about thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that I've been... unwell.  I know it's been like there's two sides to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two sides?  You're Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Jackass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserve that.  Anyway, I've... I've only just realized

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, the depth and breadth of our relationship has only recently been illuminated for me.  I know this... I know us hasn't been such a great thing for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. (to waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my food to go... Marla's getting up to go, but Jack rises, fed up, takes h by the arm, putting her back in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down!  Sit down and give me my last fifteen seconds without opening your mouth! Marla crosses her arms.  Jack collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to tell you -- and this is where you have to trust me -- but, I think your life might be in real danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to get out of here.  Leave as soon as possible.  Go to any rural town, away from any major city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an insane person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, shut up!  I've had enough. I tried, Tyler... I have tried... Marla's getting upset, tears coming to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a part of you I really like, but I can't do this anymore.  I just can't.  This is killing me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  You're sorry?  I don't believe that for a minute. Marla gets up.  Jack grabs for her, but she's gone, headi for the door.  Jack gathers his files, runs to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pushes out the door, files under one arm, catching u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
