dialogues.text: I can't explain.  You wouldn't believe me anyway.  I'm trying to protect you... Jack grabs her arm, tries to hail a TAXI, but the taxi ra past.  Marla pulls free, screaming at him...,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do this for me, Marla.  Do this for me, if you never do anything else... Jack spots a BUS idling further up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!  I don't ever want to see you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if that's what it takes, you'll never have to see me again. (digs in his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... here... He pulls MONEY from his pocket, holding it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this money, get on this bus... (pointing to bus)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on, and I promise you, I'll never bother you again, if that's what you want.  Please... Marla looks at Jack, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm begging you.  Get on the bus. Get on the bus. Marla takes the money from Tyler, walks towards the bus. they approach it, Jack shields his eyes, afraid to look..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let myself see where you're going.  Go wherever it takes you, remember... keep away from major cities... Marla stands at the doors of the bus, heartbroken, gives last look at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up the money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not paying this back.  I consider it "asshole tax."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, fine.  Just, get on.  Stay away a couple of weeks, at least. Jack's still covering his eyes.  Marla gets on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler... Jack finally looks to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the worst thing that ever happened to me. DOORS HISS SHUT.  The BUS LEAVES, heading away.  Jack see relieved.  Then, a SCREAM is HEARD from MARLA... Jack turns, looks... THROUGH THE BUS WINDOWS: the bus is filled with BALD MEN IN BLACK: Space Monkeys. Jack SPRINTS after the bus... The bus speeds away.  Onboard, Space Monkeys subdue Marla Jack falls to the asphalt, rolls, files-flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack RUNS to the front desk, crazed, dumps the armload of files on the desk in front of the DESK SERGEANT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to arrest me.  I'm the leader of a terrorist organization responsible for acts of vandalism all over the city.  Detective Stern in arson knows who I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Stern and THREE DETECTIVES stand, staring at Ja who's seated.  On the table are the phone bill and files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are probably several hundred members in the metropolitan area. Chapters are sprouting in at least five other major cities.  They're tightly-regimented, with many cells capable of operating without a central leader.  Check this address: 1537 Paper Street.  You'll find the body of Robert Paulson buried in the garden.  You'll also find numerous tubs used to make gallons of nitroglycerin.  The plan, I believe, is to blow up these credit card headquarters and the TRW building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why these buildings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not your job.  You are not how much money you have in the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other detectives)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him talking. Stern leaves.  A beat, then, the remaining Detectives smi at Jack with REVERENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really admire what you're doing. You're a brave man to order this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a genius, sir. They grab Jack and force him on his back on the table. Flat-Top has a rubber band; the Bald Detective has a knif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the drill.  You said if anyone ever tries to interfere with Project Mayhem, even you, we got to get his balls. Flat-Top PULLS Jack's pants completely off, tosses them aside.  Jack SCREAMS.  Flat-Top holds his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's useless to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is really a powerful gesture, Mr. Durden.  It'll set quite an example.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... you're making a mistake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told us you'd say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Tyler Durden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told us you'd say that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I am Tyler Durden and I'm ordering you to abort the mission!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you would definitely say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's our best time for a "cut and run?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is somebody timing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till the second hand gets to the twelve. A KNOCK at the door.  Flat-Top slaps a hand over Jack's mouth.  He and Redhead block view of the table as Baldy opens the door a crack.  Stern mutters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of this info checks out.  Let's go to the place on Paper Street. Baldy glances back at the other Detectives, leaves, closi the door.  The two remaining Detectives continue.  Jack k and screams and writhes.  The Detectives wrangle him, but with more difficulty, now that Baldy's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Durden, you're going to fuck up the time! Jack gets one leg free, KICKS, knocks Flat-top backwards Flat-Top SLAMS the wall, falls.  Redhead lets go of one o Jack's arms, jams his elbow into Jack's throat... cutting off the airway.  Jack's face reddens... he's choking... Jack's free hand reaches, searching.. pulls Redhead's GUN and points it at him.  Redhead backs off. Jack gets up, gasping for air, PISTOL-WHIPS Flat-top as he rises. Jack grabs one of the files off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, without pants, in BOXER SHORTS, escapes out the BAC DOOR.  He looks at the ADDRESS on the file folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack SPRINTS down the middle of the street, gun in hand, looking like a complete madman.  Cars almost hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, sweating and panting, stops, looks... then heads toward the BUILDING with the address "1888."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tries the door.  Locked.  He lifts a cast iron bench runs forward -- RAMS it into the glass.  The bench immediately recoils from the glass, SLAMS Jack's groin! Jack falls to his knees, doubled over, holding his packag Then, he rises, SHOOTS the glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pushes through the broken glass.  He sprints for the "PARKING" door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters, looks -- NO CARS.  He bolts to the STAIRS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters, heaving.  Again, NO CARS.  He moves from one SUPPORT POST to another, searching.  He finally spies, across the garage, NINE LARGE CANISTERS, heavily-WIRED. Jack runs to the BOMB, frantic.  He walks around it. There's a DIGITAL CLOCK, ticking down from "10:05"... Jack moves to pull the lid off one CANISTER, looks inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be worse... Jack looks -- Tyler's seated, his back against one post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be standing under 37 stories of steel and concrete with a 150 gallons of nitroglycerin strapped to the support... oh, maybe it couldn't be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at bomb)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you can't be serious about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a ridiculous thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...go through with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stop me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to let this happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop finishing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...your sentences!  They're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: our sentences.  Get your mind around that. Tyler gets up walks to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing running through the streets in your underpants?  We both use that body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is Project Mayhem about murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buildings were evacuated thirty minutes ago.  Everything's proceeding exactly as planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.  There could still be people inside. Tyler keeps walking around, crosses his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Maybe a couple of guys with shaved heads couldn't synchronize their watches.  Good riddance. Jack looks back to the BOMB, goes to it, wipes sweat off face.  He starts finger the MANY WIRES, sorting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be doing that.  Unless you know which wires, in what order...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know, I know. Jack holds his gun under one armpit, uses both hands to g through the tangle of colored wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or... maybe I knew you'd know, so I spent the whole day thinking about the wrong ones. Jack chooses one wire, GREEN, holds it in his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm wrong, we're both dead..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not about martyrdom. Jack twists the GREEN WIRE around his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pulling the green wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green?  Did you say green? Tyler comes a little closer, leaning to try to get a look seems genuinely concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pull the green wire.  Pull anything but the green wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.  That's the wrong one. Jack's unsure, swallowing, pulling the wire taunt, finger trembling.  The SOUND of a VEHICLE is HEARD from below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear that?  Marla's here.  Just in the nick of time, eh? Jack looks to Tyler.  Tyler points towards the SOUND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See for yourself. Jack releases the wire, walks to a RAILING, gun in hand, keeps an eye on Tyler.  Jack looks over the railing... BELOW, a BUS idles.  The doors open and MARLA'S dragged o kicking and screaming, carried by SIX SPACE MONKEYS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfuckers... They carry Marla into the BUILDING'S ENTRANCE. Jack leans against the railing, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got everything.  The bombs.  The army.  I've got Marla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob is dead, Tyler.  The police blew a hole in his head.  Was that part of your plan? Tyler thinks, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob was a grown man.  In any great struggle, there will be casualties. Wouldn't that be implicit in the name?  Project "Mayhem."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck your struggle.  I want out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not an option, for the most obvious of reasons.  You need to get with the program. (looks at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven minutes.  Let's get out of here. Tyler's walks away.  Jack looks at the gun in his hand. points the gun at Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (COCKS the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defuse the bomb. Tyler stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defuse the bomb, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defuse the bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tyler strides towards the BOMB.  Jack trains the gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Tyler looks at the BOMB, reaches over to it.  He grips th GREEN WIRE, yanks it out -- the CLOCK STOPS. Jack lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did that for you.  As a gesture. Now, how fast can you run?  There are ten other bombs, in ten other buildings in the immediate area.  If you're going to get them all, you better get cracking. (looks at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six minutes.  Green wires, remember. I'll be upstairs. Jack's stunned.  Tyler walks across the parking garage, p Jack, heading for the STAIRS. Jack aims the gun at Tyler's back, FIRES! Tyler ducks to one side, impossibly quick, avoiding... Tyler spins to face Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  What was that all about? Jack aims... FIRES! Tyler DODGES behind a post as the BULLET THROWS CONCRETE. Jack edges forward, gun held in both hands, moves around post... Tyler is NOT THERE.  Jack turns, takes slow steps moving the gun from side to side... Suddenly, a FIST ENTERS FRAME -- SLUGS Jack's face. Jack falls.  The gun goes CLATTERING across the floor... Jack turns, looking... Tyler's GONE.  Jack looks to the g scrambles to his feet, running to pick up the gun... Tyler KICKS Jack in the chest, sends Jack sprawling. Jack rolls, holding his chest.  He looks up, sees Tyler r into the STAIRWELL.  Jack grabs the gun and follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smashes the door open.  The stairwell's empty.  Jack RUNS up a flight of stairs, kicks open ANOTHER DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack steps forward, gun up... TWO INTERLOCKED HANDS SLAM down onto his head.  Jack drops to the floor. Tyler backs away, laughing.  Jack gets to his feet, aims gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire at will. Jack clenches his teeth, FIRING -- nothing happens to Tyl Jack FIRES TWICE -- no effect.  Tyler raises his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect? Jack charges.  Tyler dodges, PUNCHES, knocks the gun out Jack's hand.  They FIGHT, trading PUNCHES, grappling, tak each other to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of SECURITY MONITORS sit unmanned. ON ONE MONITOR: Jack is seen in the lobby, on the floor, alone, wrestling himself.  He swings his left hand up, punching empty air, then swings his right hand -- PUNCHIN himself in the side of the head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and Jack fight viciously, bloodied.  Tyler manages get his hands around Jack's throat, starts BANGING Jack's head against the floor... SECURITY MONITOR P.O.V. ... Jack's got his hands around his own throat, BANGING h own head against the floor, over and over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack manages to break Tyler's grip, KICKS Tyler away. Tyler springs to his feet, RUNS, heading for a STAIRCASE. Jack gets up, breathing hard, holding his head, follows.. ON THE STAIRS, Tyler reaches the LOFT LEVEL, above the lobby, disappears around a corner.  Jack's right behind, turning the corner -- Tyler's NOT THERE. Jack receives a SHARP SLAP on the back of the head.  He wheels.  Tyler isn't there.  A TAP on his shoulder.  Jack turns around -- WHAM! -- Tyler PUNCHES his face.  Jack fa against the loft railing.  Tyler comes forward, SWINGS... SECURITY MONITOR P.O.V. Jack PUNCHES himself square in the nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's dazed.  Tyler grabs Jack's shirt, pulls him forwar SWINGS HIM -- THROWS him DOWN THE STAIRS... Jack TUMBLES horribly down... HITS BOTTOM, striking his h on the floor.  Jack PASSES OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Jack's head jerks back as he SNAPS AWAKE.  He looks around, trying to focus his eyes... JACK'S P.O.V. -- TRACKS in the sawdust of the floor, from where his body was dragged across to where he is how. CLOSE ON: Jack tries to comprehend.  He turns his head -- TYLER'S HAND brings the GUN up, PUTS THE GUN IN JACK'S MOUTH.  Jack freezes, looks around with his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler is seated in Jack's lap.  Tyler holds the gun in Jack's mouth, his arm around him.  This huge room is bein remodeled.  Tyler and Jack are seated near floor-to-ceili windows affording a spectacular view of the CITY. Tyler looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is about where we came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the beginning.  We're at ground zero.  Maybe you should say a few words, to mark the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i... ann....iinn.. ff....nnyin... Jack tongues the barrel to the side of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't think of anything. Tyler checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting exciting now. Jack turns, so he can see down -- 31 STORIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what we've accomplished. (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds. (looks out windows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out these windows, we will view the economic collapse.  One step closer to global equilibrium.  I'm glad you're here with me. Tyler watches the skyline, WHISTLES at tune, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you call it off... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out of our hands. (looks at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds now.  Can you see alright?  10... 9... 8.... Tyler looks out the windows, at SURROUNDING BUILDINGS, excited.  Jack closes his eyes, despairing.
Out the window, the SKYLINE remains unchanged.  Nothing. long beat.  A very dark scowl comes over Tyler's face. Jack opens his eyes.  More waiting.  Tyler looks genuinel surprised, pissed-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paraffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paraffin.  Your merry band mixed the nitro with paraffin.  I saw it floating in the bomb. (more) JACK (cont)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must've run out of cotton and Epsom salt.  Paraffin is iffy at best. Tyler rises, taking the gun from Jack's mouth, starts pacing.  Jack rubs his sore jowls, allows himself a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!  God-damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly according to plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to do everything ourselves?! Tyler stops walking, lets out a sigh of disgust.  He reac into his pocket, taking out a WALKIE TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into WALKIE TALKIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Codename Rooster.  Passcode First Strike... Jack's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into WALKIE TALKIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed with remote detonation. Jack leaps -- TACKLES Tyler.  The GUN is knocked away.  J STRIKES Tyler's face repeatedly with his elbow, scrambles off... Jack gets the gun, turns, pointing it.  Tyler's getting t his feet, sees the gun, annoyed.  Jack stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't we already done this? Jack SHOOTS TWICE.  Bullets pass right thorough Tyler. Tyler just rolls his eyes, drops the walkie-talkie to the floor and STOMPS on it, CRUSHING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do that?!  You're a fucking figment of my imagination... you're psychogenic fugue state...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that, maybe you're my hallucination. Jack falters, pointing at Tyler's feet.  There's no walki talkie there.  Jack looks down, sees the WALKIE-TALKIE CRUSHED under his own foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Christ... Jack holds his head, walks around, at his wit's end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... why... why... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I get rid of you?  Why can't I just wish you away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I don't. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thank you, I really do.  Thank you, but I don't need you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can be selfish, I know that. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not blind to my own failings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo, please... Jack backs up against a window, numb and weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on, we'll share Marla. We've been spending too much time apart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more running off without you. From here on out, we do it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing this for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please understand... I've gotten all I can from this, Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sullen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I leave, you will be right back where I found you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear on my life, I won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will.  You know you will. Jack stares at Tyler, tears welling up, hangs his head. looks at the gun in his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you live with that? Jack stares at the gun a long time... then... Jack brings the gun up, PUTS THE GUN IN HIS MOUTH. Tyler cocks his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you left for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to do that? Why do you want to put that gun in your mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my mouth.  Our mouth. Tyler is calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is interesting. Tyler smiles in appreciation, slowly walks forward, stand very close to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you going with this, Ikea- boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way to get rid of you... Jack COCKS the hammer on the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see you feel very strongly.  I feel strongly too. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you and me. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends again? Their eyes are locked, unblinking.  Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eyes are open.

dialogues.speaker: EXTREME SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: Jack's finger squeezes the trigger... KABLAM! -- Jack's cheeks INFLATE with gas.  His eyes bulg BLOOD flies out from his head.  The WINDOW behind him SHATTERS.  SMOKE wafts out of his mouth and tear ducts. RESUME NORMAL SPEED as the GLASS FALLS behind Jack... Tyler stands, in gunsmoke, eyes glazed, sniffs the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell... ? Jack slumps to the floor... Tyler falls... Tyler hits the ground.  The back of TYLER'S HEAD is BLOWN OPEN, revealing blood, skull and brain. Suddenly, a GROUP of SPACE MONKEYS burst into the room, moving forward to Jack.  TYLER'S BODY IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, sir... ?! Jack quakes, holding the side of his head; a ragged hole blown in his CHEEK.  He's bleeding hard, but he's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay... Jack looks to the Space Monkeys, trying to get his eyes t see.  TWO SPACE MONKEYS enter with Marla.  One holds a gu to Marla as she struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?  You look terrible, sir!  What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you look really awful!  Do you need medical assistance? Jack sees Marla, tries to get to his feet, falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the girl to me.  The rest of you get out.  Now! The Monkeys bring Marla, releasing her, saluting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask. Marla crouches, takes out wadded TISSUES and tries to app them to Jack's wound.  Space Monkeys are leaving, hesitan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the rendezvous point.  Move it! Jack and Marla are left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, you're shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Jack tries to got up.  Marla helps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, I think.  But, I'm okay... I'm fine... MASSIVE EXPLOSION... the glass walls rattle... Jack and Marla look -- OUT THE WINDOWS: a BUILDING EXPLOD collapsing upon itself.  Then, ANOTHER BUILDING IMPLODES into a massive cloud of dust.  Jack and Marla are silhouetted against the SKYLINE.  Jack looks to Marla, reaches to take her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... you met me at a very strange time in my life. Marla looks at him.  ANOTHER BUILDING IMPLODES and COLLAP inward... and ANOTHER BUILDING... and ANOTHER... The FILM SLOWS, then ADVANCES ONE FRAME at a TIME -- SHOW SPROCKET HOLES on the SIDES.  EACH FRAME is an IMPLODING BUILDING -- then, ONE FRAME IS A PENIS.  Then, the IMPLOD BUILDING again.  SPEED UP the frames, LOSE the sprocket holes, RESUME NORMAL SPEED...
